dct_description_sm: Relief shown by 10 meter contour intervals and spot elevations. Map shows prefecture (shō or shū). gun or shi, kai or shō boundaries; three classes of roads or trails; two classes of railroads; areas of vegetation; places of worship; military posts. Some buildings are named. Place names are transcribed according to the Modified Hepburn (Romaji) System. "1-45." Military grid. Includes "Glossary." Marginal maps and diagrams: Index to boundaries -- Coverage diagram. Shoka is now officially named Changhua or Chang-hua.
dct_publisher_sm: Washington, D.C. : Army Map Service, U.S. Army, 1945.
